data.title: BC ARTISTS: B.C. Artists' 14th Annual Exhibition
data.text:
FOREWORD

This is the second non-jury exhibition to be held in the Vancouver Art Gallery.

A non-jury exhibition is one in which every person has the right to exhibit his or her work. It is a free-for-all.

A jury exhibition on the other hand is one in which pictures entered for exhibition are selected on their merits by a special committee appointed for that purpose.

The present Exhibition Committee favours holding a non-jury show every second or third year, with a jury exhibition in the years in between.

LAWREN HARRIS,

Chairman, Exhibition Committee.

September 22nd, 1945.
